docs.title: Project Overview
docs.text: The United City Church Website Redesign aims to create a modern, responsive, and user-friendly online platform for the church. This documentation provides a high-level overview of the project, including goals, page structure, and project phases.

docs.title: Project Goals
docs.text:
The goal is to redesign and launch the church’s website with a strong focus on:

  • Usability: Ensure the site is easy to navigate and mobile-responsive.
  • Manageability: Allow church staff to update pages, events, and content without technical assistance.
  • Engagement: Provide resources, event information, and next steps for church attendees and visitors.

This project is being developed on Webflow, with Amos Rivera leading design efforts in Adobe Illustrator and David Martin (developer) handling implementation.

docs.title: General Website Structure
docs.text: The new website will consist of the following primary sections, each with multiple pages:

docs.title: 1. About
docs.text:
• Pastor
  • Staff
  • Core Values
  • Testimonials

docs.title: 2. Community
docs.text:
• Kids Ministry
  • Youth Ministry
  • Young Adults
  • Groups
  • Español Ministry

docs.title: 3. Next Steps
docs.text:
• Growth Track
  • Baptism
  • Serve Opportunities
  • Missions
  • Creative Department

docs.title: 4. Resources
docs.text:
• Sermons
  • UC Online (live stream and recorded services)
  • Events Calendar
  • Podcast
  • Giving Page

docs.title: 5. Other Pages
docs.text:
• Pre-school Program
  • UC Residency
  • Vision Team
  • Privacy Policy
  • Blog

docs.title: Phase 1: Design & Development
docs.text:
We will work on each section of the site sequentially, dedicating approximately one month per section:

  • Community Pages: January – February 2025 (In progress)
  • Next Steps Pages: March 2025
  • Resources Pages: April 2025
  • About Pages: May 2025
  • Other Pages: June 2025

Amos will finalize designs in Adobe Illustrator for each section. Development will focus on translating these designs into responsive Webflow pages.

docs.title: Phase 2: Ongoing Development
docs.text: Simultaneously, we will integrate Planning Center events into the Webflow CMS. This will be achieved using Zapier to automate event updates from Planning Center to the website.

docs.title: Phase 3: Testing
docs.text:
Starting in July 2025, church staff will participate in a comprehensive testing phase to:

  • Review page content and functionality.
  • Provide feedback on design and usability.
  • Identify and report bugs by attempting to "break" the site.

docs.title: Phase 4: Final Review and Launch Prep
docs.text:
The final review and launch preparations will occur from September 1 to September 30, 2025. Tasks will include:

  • Final content approval.
  • Hosting plan setup.
  • Final QA checks.

The website is scheduled to launch on October 1, 2025, ahead of the Christmas season.

docs.title: Design
docs.text: • Amos Rivera: Designs all page layouts and handles copywriting for each section.

docs.title: Development
docs.text: • David Martin: Implements designs in Webflow, ensures responsiveness, and builds custom features (e.g., Vimeo autoplay script, API integration, etc).

docs.title: Stakeholders
docs.text: • Church leaders and staff will provide feedback and approve final content.

docs.title: Ongoing Documentation and Communication
docs.text:
This documentation site will serve as a hub for:

  1. Tracking project milestones and the development timeline.
  2. Documenting page development and ongoing integration efforts.
  3. Maintaining notes on changes, tasks, and feature updates.

Regular updates will be made to keep all stakeholders informed.

docs.title: Development Timeline and Milestones
docs.text: We aim to complete the United City Church Website by October 1, 2025, in preparation for the Christmas season.

docs.title: Planning Center Integration
docs.text:
• Goal: Sync church events from Planning Center to Webflow CMS using Zapier.
